content.description: Terra Nova is a National Park so be mindful or park rules and visitor permit requirements when climbing.  It is recommended that you check the Parks Canada Website for guidance in climbing in Canada's national parks  (There is no specific climbing information for Terra Nova, but following rules for hiking is a good place to start.) .  The park is a beautiful place with significant areas of well weathered  granite which makes for amazing climbing rock that feels nice on the hands. There has been almost no development of climbing routes in this area.  Most of the best looking and largest crags are found along the coast and are accessible only by boat.  However, there are also a number of smaller areas accessible by short hikes from roads.  The park stretches along the Trans Canada Highway from Glover town in the west to around Port Blandford in the east, but most of the climbing potential is in the western end and along the coast.
